meanings.definition: A remote or wild area, typically in Africa.
meanings.sent1: The explorers ventured deep into the bundu to study rare animals.
meanings.sent2: The bundu is home to many exotic plants and animals.
meanings.sent3: The tourists got lost in the bundu but found their way back with a map.
meanings.sent4: The bundu whispered ancient secrets to those who dared to enter.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the bundu, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A thick, tangled mass of vegetation or undergrowth.
meanings.sent1: The hikers struggled to cut through the dense bundu blocking their path.
meanings.sent2: The bundu provided excellent cover for the hidden animals.
meanings.sent3: The gardener fought a battle against the stubborn bundu in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The bundu seemed to entangle all who dared to pass through it.
meanings.sent5: The bundu rustled with unseen movements, creating an air of mystery.

meanings.definition: To go into the bundu, to go into the wilderness.
meanings.sent1: The brave explorer decided to bundu into the unknown territory.
meanings.sent2: They bundu-ed through the thick forest, guided by the stars above.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to bundu in their backyard jungle.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of freedom as she bundu-ed deeper into the forest.
meanings.sent5: Bundu-ing into the wilderness, he discovered a hidden waterfall.
